jabber.JIDUtil

type
class
available in
neko, js, flash, php, node
Static methods for JabberID manipulation/validation.

Static Variables

EREG : EReg

Regular expression matching a valid JID

MAX_PARTSIZE(inline,null) : Int

MAX_SIZE(inline,null) : Int

MIN_LENGTH(inline,null) : Int

Static Methods

compare(a : JID, b : JID) : Bool

escapeNode(n : String) : String

Escapes the node portion of a JID according to "JID Escaping" (XEP-0106).
Escaping replaces characters prohibited by node-prep with escape sequences.
Typically, escaping is performed only by a client that is processing information provided by a human user in unescaped form, or by a gateway to some external system (e.g., email or LDAP) that needs to generate a JID.

getParts(jid : String) : Array<String>

returns
A String array with parsed node, domain and resource.

inline hasResource(t : String) : Bool

returns
True if the given JID has a valid resource.

isValid(t : String) : Bool

returns
True if the given JID is valid formed.

parseBare(t : String) : String

Removes The resource from a JID.

parseDomain(t : String) : String

returns
The domain of the given JID.

inline parseNode(t : String) : String

returns
The node of the given JID.

parseResource(t : String) : String

returns
The resource of the given JID.

splitBare(jid : String) : Array<String>

Splits the given JID into parts and returns it as array excluding the resource.

unescapeNode(n : String) : String

Un-escapes the node portion of a JID according to "JID Escaping" (XEP-0106: JID Escaping).
Escaping replaces characters prohibited by node-prep with escape sequences.
Typically, unescaping is performed only by a client that wants to display JIDs containing escaped characters to a human user, or by a gateway to some external system (e.g., email or LDAP) that needs to generate identifiers for foreign systems.
